intro: Acinodendron tetrandrum, commonly known as the four-threaded acacia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant has a woody stem with thorny branches, typical of many Acacia species. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, flat pods that contain seeds. Due to its unique morphology and restricted habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
